intro: Chisocheton pohlianus, commonly known as the Pohli's chisocheton, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs characterized by their aromatic wood and often ornamental flowers. The plant is distinguished by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is typically found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
